org.eng.aisp.classifier

Class ConfusionMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eng.aisp.classifier.ConfusionMatrix

  • public class ConfusionMatrix
extends Object
    Generates a Confusion Matrix for two lists of labels. It does so by comparing index X to index Y and seeing if they are the same. Main Data Structure is a HashMap of HashMaps. RealLabel->PredicteLabel->Count.
    Author:
    Eduardo Morales

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ConfusionMatrix.Normalization
      Defines the way the percentages are calculated in the Percents confusion matrix via #get

      • getCounts

        public Map<String,Map<String,Integer>> getCounts()
        Get the count of predicted labels for each actual label vs the predicted label. A map of true classification labels is used as the keys in the returned map. Each value of a key in the returned map is a map with keys as the predicted values. The value under the predicted value keys is the number of times a datum was classified as the predicted value.
        Returns:
        never null.

      • getPercents

        public Map<String,Map<String,Double>> getPercents()
        A convenience on getPercents(Normalization) using Object.notifyAll() normalization.

      • getPercents

        public Map<String,Map<String,Double>> getPercents(ConfusionMatrix.Normalization normalization)
        Get the percentage of predicted labels for each actual label vs the predicted label. A map of true classification labels is used as the keys in the returned map. Each value of a key in the returned map is a map with the predicted values as keys. The value under the predicted value keys is the percentage of all values predicted according to the normalization type. (i.e. this is normalized across the whole matrix so that the sum of values in all cells is 100).
        Parameters:
        normalization - if All, then percentages across the whole matrix sum to 100. if Recall, then all values within a row (actual values) sum to 100. Precision is not yet supported.
        Returns:
        never null.

      • compute

        public static <WINDATA> ConfusionMatrix compute(String labelName,
                                                IFixedClassifier<WINDATA> classifier,
                                                Iterable<? extends ILabeledDataWindow<WINDATA>> srList)
                                         throws AISPException
        A convenience on compute(String, IFixedClassifier, Iterable, boolean) that does not go parallel to compute.
        Throws:
        AISPException

      • compute

        public static <WINDATA> ConfusionMatrix compute(String labelName,
                                                IFixedClassifier<WINDATA> classifier,
                                                Iterable<? extends ILabeledDataWindow<WINDATA>> srList,
                                                boolean inParallel)
                                         throws AISPException
        Given a classifier, a list of sounds and a labelName -- classify the sounds and compute Confusion Matrix
        Parameters:
        labelName -
        classifier -
        srList -
        inParallel - if true, then perform classification parallel. In this case, ordering of predicted and real labels in the resulting confusion matrix will not match the ordering of windows in the given srList. In general, this should be set to true except when the classifier being used is not thread-safe, which it should be.
        Throws:
        AISPException

      • getPercentsArray

        protected double[][] getPercentsArray(ConfusionMatrix.Normalization normalization)
        Converts the allPercentsMap into a 2D array for count and percentage and returns it Provided primarily for junit tests. Try not to use internally.
        Returns:
        percentsArray

      • getCountsArray

        protected double[][] getCountsArray()
        Converts the countsMap to a 2Darray and returns it. Provided primarily for junit tests. Try not to use internally. The problem with this is that the row and column associations are not stated.
        Returns:
        countsArray

      • add

        public ConfusionMatrix add(ConfusionMatrix matrix)
        Add the two matrices together to create a new one - do not modify this instance or the given matrix. The returned matrix must add the means from the two matrices and keep statistics on the various accuracies so that getAccuracy() and other methods can return OnlineStats objects.
        Parameters:
        matrix -
        Returns:
        a new matrix that maintains the accuracy statistics in the addition of the two matrices.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the two matrices were not computed from the same label name.
